sndlib.ext.generators.gml
Class ProblemGmlProperties

java.lang.Object
  com.atesio.gml.gen.GmlProperties
      sndlib.ext.generators.gml.BaseGmlProperties
          sndlib.ext.generators.gml.ProblemGmlProperties

public class ProblemGmlProperties
extends BaseGmlProperties

This class collects the properties to be used when generating a GML for a Problem.

Note: The support of property values resp. their ranges depends on the used visualizer. We can recommend the free graph editor yEd, which is a simple, easy to use tool for viewing, editing and analyzing GML graphs.
Some style constants supported by yEd are collected in GmlStyles.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
GmlStyles, ProblemGmlGenerator

getProblemLinkColor

public java.awt.Color getProblemLinkColor()
Returns the link color to be used when generating a GML for a Problem.

If no individual color was set, explicitly by setProblemLinkColor(Color) or implicitly by load(Properties), the default color provided by GmlProperties.getLinkColor() is returned.

Returns:
the link color

setProblemLinkColor

public void setProblemLinkColor(java.awt.Color problemLinkColor)
Sets the link color to be used when generating a GML for a Problem.

Parameters:
problemLinkColor - the link color

getProblemLinkStyle

public java.lang.String getProblemLinkStyle()
Returns the link style to be used when generating a GML for a Problem.

If no individual style was set, explicitly by setProblemLinkStyle(String) or implicitly by load(Properties), the default style provided by GmlProperties.getLinkStyle() is returned.

Returns:
the link style

setProblemLinkStyle

public void setProblemLinkStyle(java.lang.String problemLinkStyle)
Sets the link style to be used when generating a GML for a Problem.

Note: The available link styles depend on the used visualizer. If using yEd, some link style constants are collected in GmlStyles.LinkStyle.

Parameters:
problemLinkStyle - the link style

getProblemLinkWidth

public int getProblemLinkWidth()
Returns the link width to be used when generating a GML for a Problem.

If no individual width was set, explicitly by setProblemLinkWidth(int) or implicitly by load(Properties), the default width provided by GmlProperties.getLinkWidth() is returned.

the link width
